clinical_study.brief_title: Medical Nutrition Therapy Intervention Program for Women With Gestational Diabetes--a Prospective Study
clinical_study.official_title: Individualized Medical Nutrition Therapy Intervention Program for Women With Gestational Diabetes

lead_sponsor.agency: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

clinical_study.source: The Third Xiangya Hospital of Central South University

brief_summary.textblock: Gestational diabetes mellitus (GDM) is one of the most frequent complications of pregnancy, that affect between 1 to 14% of population around the world. The overall purpose of this study is to determine the efficacy of individualized medical nutrition therapy (MNT) intervention to reduce and control the development of GDM.

detailed_description.textblock: The number of women with gestational diabetes mellitus had been increasing. Maternal GDM has a great impact on both the health of the mothers and the offspring. Antenatal lifestyle interventions, in particular dietary intervention appear to be feasible to improve maternal GDM and weight gain. To the best of our knowledge, there has been no such trial examining the feasibility of MNT intervention in pregnant women in Hu'nan province. The aim of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of individualized MNT intervention to reduce and control the development of GDM. This is a prospective study, 500 patients who meet inclusion and exclusion criteria will be included. The changes of glucose and weight will be evaluated every two weeks.

primary_outcome.time_frame: every two weeks, from date of randomization until the date of parturition, assessed up to 10 months
primary_outcome.description: Investigators will measure the participants' intravenous glucose every two weeks.From date of randomization until the date of parturition,assessed up to 10 months.

arm_group.description: A comparison of normal lifestyle and medical nutrition therapy after intervention in the same individual

intervention.description: The intervention group involves dietary and exercise advice and monitoring.
